title: Bug 49299 - Incorrect behavior when custom cookie name is used for URL rewriting
description:
In chapter 7.1.1 of the servlet30finalspec.pdf, it is stated that if a web application configures a custom name for its session tracking cookies, the same custom name will be used as the name of the URI parameter if the session id is encoded in the URL (provided that URL rewriting has been enabled).

However, the actual behavior is different. When a custom cookie name is set, the page sends the cookie with the name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE', but the 'Reload' link on the page still uses 'jsessionid' as the parameter.

Attachment 25442 contains the sample web application 'cookiename.war' which demonstrates this issue.
OB:
When using the web application 'cookiename.war', the page sends the following cookie:

SetCookie: MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F; Path=/cookiename; HttpOnly

However, the 'Reload' link on the page uses 'jsessionid' as the parameter:

http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;jsessionid=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F4
EB:
Expected behavior: If the custom name 'MYSESSIONCOOKIE' is set for session tracking cookies, the 'Reload' link should use the custom name as the parameter instead of 'jsessionid'.

Expected Reload link:

http://localhost:8080/cookiename/index.jsp;MYSESSIONCOOKIE=658C60E714E9C7C833F4FDA366E0477F
